labels.analysis: The MCP Server described is called the Hackle API Server. It primarily focuses on providing tools to interact with A/B testing data through the Hackle API. The available tools allow users to manage various aspects of A/B testing, in-app messaging, push notifications, analytics, and remote configuration. The core functionality revolves around retrieving and manipulating data related to experiments, user engagement metrics, and configuration management. This server facilitates the integration of A/B testing insights into applications, enabling data-driven decision-making for experimentation workflows.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of the Hackle API Server is centered around analytics and data processing, particularly in the context of A/B testing and user engagement metrics. This aligns closely with the "Data Analysis & Processing" category. Additional functionalities like remote configuration management and message handling also suggest relevance to "API Integration" since the server enables seamless integration of these features into applications. The server's focus on experimentation and decision-making further justifies these labels.

server_info_crawled.name: Hackle API Server
server_info_crawled.author: @hackle-io/hackle-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide tools and resources to query A/B Test data through the Hackle API. Enable seamless integration of A/B testing insights into your applications. Facilitate efficient data retrieval and manipulation for experimentation workflows.

tools.name: experiment-list
tools.description: Deploy Server Hackle API Server @hackle-io/hackle-mcp Try in Playground experiment-list

tools.name: experiment-detail
tools.description: Retrieves detailed information for a specific A/B test experiment.

tools.name: in-app-message-list
tools.description: Fetches a paginated list of in-app messages with search functionality.

tools.name: in-app-message-detail
tools.description: Retrieves detailed information for a specific in-app message.

tools.name: push-message-list
tools.description: Fetches a paginated list of push messages with search functionality.

tools.name: push-message-detail
tools.description: Retrieves detailed information for a specific push message.

tools.name: active-user-series
tools.description: Retrieves time-series data of active users. Available in daily, weekly, and monthly units.

tools.name: retention-series
tools.description: Retrieves time-series data of user retention. Available in daily, weekly, and monthly units.

tools.name: stickiness-series
tools.description: Retrieves time-series data of user stickiness (return visit frequency). Available in weekly and monthly units.

tools.name: analytics-chart-detail
tools.description: fetch analytics chart detail. You can visualize the chart using this tool's result.

tools.name: remote-config-create
tools.description: Creates an empty remote config. It is recommended to update an existing RC first if there is an associated RC with the one you want to create since the total number of RC is limited.

tools.name: remote-config-update-user-identifier-criteria
tools.description: Updates remote config's user identifier criteria. The change will be applied to both production and development environment.

tools.name: remote-config-update-description
tools.description: Updates remote config's description. The change will be applied to both production and development environment.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@hackle-io/hackle-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: apiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Your API key for the Hackle API. This must be provided to start the MCP server.
